name: Olanzapine (Zyprexa)
summary: An atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, with additional off-label uses for treatment-resistant depression and other psychiatric conditions.
description: Olanzapine is a second-generation (atypical) antipsychotic that works by antagonizing dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors, among others. It is effective in reducing psychotic symptoms, stabilizing mood, and managing acute manic episodes. Compared to first-generation antipsychotics, it has a lower risk of extrapyramidal symptoms but is associated with significant metabolic side effects.

items: Bipolar I Disorder — acute manic or mixed episodes

sections.text: Blocks dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors; also antagonizes histamine H1, muscarinic M1–M5, and alpha-1 adrenergic receptors.

adult.schizophrenia: 5–10 mg/day initially, increase by 5 mg/day at intervals >24 hours; usual range: 10–20 mg/day
adult.bipolar_acute_mania: 10–15 mg once daily; may increase by 5 mg/day

sections.hepatic_impairment: Start at lower dose; monitor closely

items: Tablets: 2.5 mg, 5 mg, 7.5 mg, 10 mg, 15 mg, 20 mg
Orally disintegrating tablets: 5 mg, 10 mg, 15 mg, 20 mg

sections.text: Initial improvement may be seen within 1 week; full effect may take several weeks.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: Risk of significant weight gain and metabolic syndrome

items: Signs of EPS or tardive dyskinesia

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or use caution
sections.pediatrics: Approved for schizophrenia and bipolar I disorder in adolescents ≥13 years
sections.geriatrics: Greater risk of sedation, orthostatic hypotension, metabolic effects

sections.text: Gradually taper to avoid withdrawal symptoms such as insomnia, nausea, or relapse of psychiatric symptoms.

items: Among the highest risk antipsychotics for weight gain and metabolic syndrome
Orally disintegrating formulation useful for patients with swallowing difficulties
Effective for acute agitation via intramuscular injection

seo.description: Olanzapine (Zyprexa) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, with strong efficacy but notable metabolic side effects.
